verses.text: But the Israelites were unfaithful regarding the devoted things; Achan the son of Carmi, son of Zabdi, son of Zerah, from the tribe of Judah, took some of the devoted things, and the Lord’s anger burned against the Israelites.
verses.comment: Retains Hebrew names and the idea of 'devoted things' (herem).

verses.text: Joshua sent men from Jericho to Ai, which is near Beth Aven, east of Bethel, and said to them, 'Go up and spy out the land.' So the men went up and spied out Ai.
verses.comment: Keeps locations clear and accurate.

verses.text: They returned to Joshua and said to him, 'Do not let all the people go up. Only about two or three thousand men need to go up and attack Ai. Do not make all the people toil there, for they are few.'
verses.comment: Follows the original suggestion of a small force.

verses.text: So about three thousand men went up from the people, but they fled before the men of Ai.
verses.comment: No significant changes.

verses.text: The men of Ai struck down about thirty-six of them and pursued them before the gate as far as Shebarim, and struck them down on the slope. So the hearts of the people melted and became as water.
verses.comment: 'Melted and became as water' reproduces Hebrew idiom.

verses.text: Then Joshua tore his clothes and fell to the ground on his face before the ark of the Lord until evening, both he and the elders of Israel. And they put dust on their heads.
verses.comment: Keeps ancient sign of mourning.

verses.text: And Joshua said, 'Alas, Lord GOD, why have you brought this people over the Jordan at all? To give us into the hands of the Amorites, to destroy us? Would that we had been content to dwell beyond the Jordan!'
verses.comment: Follows Hebrew structure with 'Alas, Lord GOD.'

verses.text: 'O Lord, what can I say, when Israel has turned their backs before their enemies?'
verses.comment: Direct, literal rendering.

verses.text: 'For the Canaanites and all the inhabitants of the land will hear about it and will surround us and cut off our name from the earth. And what will you do for your great name?'
verses.comment: Preserves the concern for God's reputation.

verses.text: The Lord said to Joshua, 'Get up! Why have you fallen on your face?'
verses.comment: Direct, literal quotation.

verses.text: 'Israel has sinned; they have transgressed my covenant which I commanded them. They have even taken some of the devoted things, stolen, lied, and put them among their own possessions.'
verses.comment: Retains all verbs used in the original.

verses.text: 'Therefore the Israelites cannot stand before their enemies; they turn their backs before their enemies because they have become devoted to destruction. I will not be with you anymore unless you destroy the devoted things from among you.'
verses.comment: Includes nuance of 'devoted to destruction.'

verses.text: 'Get up! Consecrate the people and say, "Consecrate yourselves for tomorrow, for thus says the Lord, the God of Israel: There are devoted things among you, O Israel. You cannot stand before your enemies until you take away the devoted things from among you."'
verses.comment: 'Consecrate' preserves the Hebrew idiom.

verses.text: 'In the morning you shall be brought near, tribe by tribe, and the tribe that the Lord takes shall draw near by clans, and the clan that the Lord takes shall draw near by households, and the household that the Lord takes shall draw near man by man.'
verses.comment: Follows the selection process in detail.

verses.text: 'And he who is taken with the devoted things shall be burned with fire, he and all that he has, because he has transgressed the covenant of the Lord, and has done a disgraceful thing in Israel.'
verses.comment: Preserves harsh judgment as in Hebrew text.

verses.text: So Joshua rose early in the morning and brought Israel near by tribes, and the tribe of Judah was taken.
verses.comment: Literal narrative.

verses.text: He brought near the clans of Judah, and the clan of the Zerahites was taken. And he brought near the clan of the Zerahites man by man, and Zabdi was taken.
verses.comment: Retains the order of selection.

verses.text: Then he brought near his household man by man, and Achan, the son of Carmi, son of Zabdi, son of Zerah, of the tribe of Judah, was taken.
verses.comment: Long genealogy included as in original.

verses.text: Then Joshua said to Achan, 'My son, give glory to the Lord, the God of Israel, and give praise to him. Tell me now what you have done; do not hide it from me.'
verses.comment: 'Give glory and praise' reproduces the Hebrew idiom.

verses.text: Achan answered Joshua, 'Truly, I have sinned against the Lord, the God of Israel, and this is what I did:'
verses.comment: Confession preserved.

verses.text: 'When I saw among the spoil a beautiful robe from Shinar, two hundred shekels of silver, and a bar of gold weighing fifty shekels, I desired them and took them; and behold, they are hidden in the ground inside my tent, with the silver underneath.'
verses.comment: 'Shinar' retained as the Hebrew place name.

verses.text: So Joshua sent messengers, and they ran to the tent; and behold, the valuables were hidden in his tent, with the silver underneath.
verses.comment: No significant changes.

verses.text: And they took them out of the tent and brought them to Joshua and to all the Israelites, and they laid them out before the Lord.
verses.comment: Literal rendering.

verses.text: Then Joshua and all Israel with him took Achan the son of Zerah, the silver, the robe, the gold bar, his sons and daughters, his oxen, donkeys, and sheep, his tent, and all that he had; and they brought them up to the Valley of Achor.
verses.comment: Lists all included in the judgment.

verses.text: And Joshua said, 'Why have you brought trouble upon us? The Lord will bring trouble upon you today.' And all Israel stoned him with stones; they burned them with fire and stoned them with stones.
verses.comment: Clarifies plural (‘them’)—from context, this refers to Achan and his household.

verses.text: And they raised over him a great heap of stones that remains to this day. Then the Lord turned from the fierceness of his anger. Therefore that place has been called the Valley of Achor to this day.
verses.comment: 'Valley of Achor' means 'valley of trouble.'
